abstracts.cdata!:
The project consists of: (a)
            planting/replanting with high yielding varieties of cocoa up
            to 72,000 acres; (b) training staff and farmers in modern
            cocoa production techniques; (c) rehabilitating 216 acres of
            state-owned seed gardens with Amazon hybrid varieties and
            establishing a 25 acre seed garden of varieties resistent to
            swollen shoot virus disease; (d) constructing or
            rehabilitating and upgrading of 663 miles of
            secondary/farm-access roads in project areas; and (e)
            providing office facilities and staff quarters for project
            administration entities.
